intro: Conostegia donnell-smithii, commonly known as the Mexican white cedar, is a member of the Cupressaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in the mountainous regions of Mexico. The plant is characterized by its scale-like leaves and reddish-brown bark. It produces small, spherical cones that contain seeds. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
